thread.title: Royals one loss away from season ending
thread.title_full: Royals one loss away from season ending - KCTV5

author: Dave Eckert, Assignment Editor
title: Royals one loss away from season ending
text:
Astros pitcher Dallas Keuchel's 124th and final pitch was a fastball that struck out Lorenzo Cain to end the 7th inning.
Keuchel's first 123 pitches were pretty good too, In the end, Keuchel was better than the Royals pitchers, and the Astros beat the Royals for a two-one lead in the American League Divisional Series.
The Royals have to win Monday or their season is over.
"You know, if there's a group that can come back, has their back against the wall, and a group that can back out of it, it's this group. We gotta have the same mentality as we did when we dropped the first one back home. We need to try and even this one out and get back to The K and see what happens after that," first baseman Eric Hosmer said.
 "We gotta stay confident. We'll see what happens tomorrow. We're gonna come ready to go and give it our all and see what happens," outfielder Lorenzo Cain stated.
"None of us are ready to go home, So we'll go back out there and play to our strengths, pitch to our strengths and go get it because nobody is gonna give it to us," pitcher Danny Duffy said.
"We've come too far as a team, and we realize we're one loss away from our season being over. But, we can't think like that. We gotta go out here tomorrow and just play the game and do what we can" Hosmer exclaimed.
There's even more on the line for Royals left fielder Alex Gordon. If the Royals don't win Monday, that could be Gordon's last game as a Royal.
